title: Manchester City's young guns guarantee the club a "brilliant" future says Yaya Toure
text:
Manchester City's young guns guarantee the club a "brilliant" future says Yaya Toure Talismanic midfielder raves after Blues fans' first taste of Raheem Sterling, Leroy Sane and Gabriel Jesus together Share Sterling, Sane and Jesus (insets) are the next generation of Man City heroes (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Yaya Toure reckons Manchester City 's future is “brilliant”, because of Raheem Sterling, Gabriel Jesus and Leroy Sane . 
Boss Pep Guardiola fielded 22-year-old Sterling , Sane, 21, and teenager Jesus together for the first time in Saturday's 3-0 FA Cup win at Crystal Palace, and they provided an exciting glimpse of City's future. 
With 20-year-old striker Kelechi Iheanacho also to be added to the youthful mix, City's future front-line will be frightening if that quartet develops as expected. 
Midfielder Toure, 33, a talisman of the Blues' teams that won the title in 2012 and 2014, said: “It is very important for City to have these young players because football keeps going and the new generation is coming [through] stronger. Iheanacho is another City attacking option with years of service ahead of him (Photo: Getty) Read More Sterling forced to adapt £3m mansion so it doesn't cripple nearby space observatory 
“We have big players around and those players are going to learn from the experienced players like me, Bacary Sagna, Aleksandr Kolarov, Vinny Kompany. 
“It is very important to keep going like that and keep pushing like that because we know if they perform like they performed against Crystal Palace, for example — like Sane, who is doing very well at the moment — it is going to be brilliant for the club and for the future of this club.” 
As well as Sane, Toure also raved about £27m new boy Jesus, who sparkled on his full debut in the victory at Selhurst Park. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
